doc:
Max Dill https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Max_Dill 0 Max M. Dill (September 15, 1876 in Cleveland, Ohio – November 21, 1949 in San Francisco, California) was an American vaudeville comedian who starred briefly in film between 1916 and 1917. Dill was part of the vaudeville team Kolb and Dill, partnering with Clarence Kolb. Dill's short career in film began when he was 39 years old. Kolb co-starred in some of his films. Dill worked in Beloved Rogues with actor Harry von Meter in 1917, and it was Dill's last film, though he lived for decades more. (Kolb later returned to films and was a busy Hollywood character actor from the 1930s to the 1950s.) Max_M._Dill ( September_15_,_1876 in Cleveland , Ohio – November_21_,_1949 in San_Francisco , California ) was an_American_vaudeville_comedian who starred briefly in film between 1916_and_1917 . Dill worked in Beloved_Rogues with actor_Harry_von_Meter in 1917 , and it was Dill 's_last_film , though he lived for decades_more .
